summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to FBI personnel, dated December 13, 2018, requesting investigative follow-up on Jeffrey Epstein. The requests include obtaining provider information for a phone number from a SORNA registration, checking a number via WhatsApp, and conducting database searches on a New York property address linked to Epstein and his modeling agency, MC2.

persons.name: Young, Amanda N.
persons.context: Recipient of the email, addressed as FBI in New York, being asked to perform investigative tasks related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffrey
persons.context: Referred to as the owner, at least in part, of a property at 301 E. 66th Street, which is connected to his modeling agency MC2.

connections.description: Amanda Young, as FBI personnel, is being directed to conduct investigative searches (phone, property) related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Investigation follow-up request
events.description: An AUSA emails FBI personnel requesting specific investigative steps regarding Jeffrey Epstein, including phone record checks and a property search.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email is a direct communication from a federal prosecutor to the FBI, dated December 13, 2018, showing active investigative steps in the Epstein case.
It references a phone number from a SORNA (Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act) registration, indicating Epstein was a registered sex offender.
It identifies 301 E. 66th Street as a property at least partially owned by Jeffrey Epstein, used to house models for his agency MC2.
